Container.Name: webhook.site Frontend
Container.Overview: (Frontend) A website to generate unique, random URLs that you can use to test and debug Webhooks and HTTP requests, as well as to create your own workflows.
Container.Requires:
Requires a separate Redis database and "webhook.site Backend" (also available in Community Applications).
You must enter a container console and run the following command upon each startup:
`sed -i -e 's/laravel-echo-server:6001/${BACKEND_SERVER_HOST}:${BACKEND_SERVER_PORT}/g' /etc/nginx/conf.d/nginx.conf`

Config.Name: Server Host
Config.Description: Hostname for the backend server. Replace with IP address of the backend server.

Config.Name: App URL
Config.Description: Application URL. Replace with IP and port. Port must match Web UI Port

Config.Name: Redis Host
Config.Description: Redis host. Replace with IP address of Redis server.

Config.Description: Application environment. Not recommended to change.
